channel.title: Talks on Jesse Szwedko
channel.description: Recent content in Talks on Jesse Szwedko

item.title: Debugging Go
item.description: Talk I gave at the Go Steel Programmers meet-up group in Pittsburgh about the current state of Go debugging (both traditional debuggers as well as print/log based debugging).

item.title: Golang ORMs: A survey of the current state of Golang ORMs
item.description: Talk I gave at the Go Steel Programmers meet-up group in Pittsburgh about the current state of Go ORMs.

item.title: The Path to Go 1.1
item.description: Talk given at the Go Steel Programmers meet-up group in Pittsburgh about changes in the version 1.1 release of Go with Sheena Smith.

item.title: Continous Delivery: Reliable software development through automation
item.description: Talk I gave to undergraduate students at the University of Pittsburgh as part of Computer Science Department’s Tech Talk series where industry members give talks about topics not typically covered in undergraduate computer science course work. The talk covers the basics of source control, test automation, and deployment automation using git, Travis CI, and capistrano.
